oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sculpture by Puryear Mims: The Mountain Group, Nashville, Tennessee, 2015 February 08
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of “The Mountain Group” sculpture artwork by Thomas Puryear Mims, circa Feb. 8th, 2015. This bronze artwork of a pioneer family, along with three other thematic subjects, was sculpted by Puryear Mims in the 1950s. This public art is located on the grounds of Cordell Hull building in Nashville, Tennessee. Puryear Mims, a native of Nashville, was the son of a Vanderbilt professor and was affiliated with the Vanderbilt Art Department. He spent part of the 1930s working on a fellowship that sent him through the rural South, carving images of the farmers and coal miners he met. Mims created numerous public sculptures around Nashville. Forms part of the Leanne Garland Photograph Collection. 1 digital photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mims, Thomas Puryear, 1906-1975
Cordell Hull State Office Building (Nashville, Tenn.)
